Pyruvate kinase deficiency is found in people of all ethnic backgrounds.
- Anemia - A yellowing of the whites of the eyes (icterus) - Fatigue, lethargy - Jaundice - Pale skin (pallor)
During a physical exam, the doctor will look for an enlarged spleen.

Tests include the following: - Bilirubin in the blood - CBC - Genetic testing for mutation in the pyruvate kinase gene - Large red blood cells (macrocytosis) - Levels of haptoglobin in the blood - Osmotic fragility - Pyruvate kinase activity - Stool urobilinogen
They are made of too much bilirubin, which is produced during hemolytic anemia.
Severe pneumococcal disease is a possible complication after splenectomy.
See your health care provider if: - You have jaundice (this is a symptom of many severe illnesses) - You have a family history of this disorder and are planning to have children
